headline: Air Products Reports Mixed Q4 With EPS Gains, Revenue Miss, And Solid Cash Flow
summary: Air Products & Chemicals Inc (NYSE:APD) reported fourth-quarter 2024 adjusted EPS of $3.56, beating the consensus of $3.48. Quarterly sales reached $3.187 billion, a slight 0.10% year-over-year decline, missing the $3.21 billion consensus, as volume and price gains were offset by lower energy cost pass-through. Sales by segments: Americas $1.307 billion (-3% YoY), Europe $730.9 million (+3% YoY), and Asia $861.2 million (+7% YoY). Operating income for the quarter rose to $2.424 billion from $738

summary: The flat Q4 sales of APD are attributed to 1% increased volumes and pricing offset by 2% lower energy cost pass-through.

headline: Air Products and Chemicals (APD) Surpasses Q4 Earnings Estimates
summary: Air Products and Chemicals (APD) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of 3.49% and 0.16%, respectively, for the quarter ended September 2024. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Air Products and Chemicals: Fiscal Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: For the year, the company reported profit of $3.83 billion, or $17.18 per share. Revenue was reported as $12.1 billion. For the current quarter ending in December, Air Products and Chemicals expects its per-share earnings to range from $2.75 to $2.85.

headline: Air Products Reports Fiscal 2024 Fourth Quarter GAAP EPS of $8.81 and Adjusted EPS of $3.56
summary: Fiscal 2024 Full-Year Consolidated ResultsAir Products (NYSE:APD) today reported full-year fiscal 2024 results, including GAAP EPS from continuing operations of $17.24, up 67 percent from the prior year. GAAP net income of $3.9 billion was up 65 percent and GAAP net income margin of 31.9 percent increased 1,330 basis points, in each case primarily due to a $1.2 billion after-tax gain recognized upon the sale of the Company's former LNG business at the end of the fourth quarter.
